text: methods soap box is the first LEED
Platinum certified Factory in the
industry okay great but what does that
even mean
short answer the factory is green long
answer the factory creates less waste
uses less energy and provides better
working conditions for its employees
than other factories so LEED is
basically the most popular green
building certification in the world it
was developed in 1993 by the US Green
Building Council and it since become an
international standard for green
building construction so we're here at
massive sofox Factory in Chicago to see
what it takes to go platinum green
office buildings in the US are at an
all-time high and Chicago is the
country's greenest city for the second
year in a row buildings are considered
officially green certified if they have
an Energy Star label LEED certification
or both nearly 70% of Chicago is green
certified we were inspired by others in
the community that had brought a wind
turbine on-site and we went through the
process of procuring one to produce as
much energy as possible here in the
Windy City the US Green Building Council
Awards certification at four levels
based on a point system but the soap box
Platinum distinction is the gold medal
of certifications methods 85 points come
from five things location materials
renewable energy indoor environment
quality and innovation the turbine
provides half the factory's annual
electric energy while a set of solar
trees and renewable energy from the grid
provide the rest that was an investment
but as that investment pays off over
time it'll be the most efficient and
freest energy available so that takes
care of renewable energy but what about
the other four certification points it
was a toxic site that we kind of renewed
and regenerated the majority of the land
the factory is built on has been
restored to native prairie land and
that's open to the community and the
environment inside the factory is
intentionally designed to keep employees
happy and
the skylights and large windows give
workers more access to natural light
while also lowering the building's
baseline energy use and the paint's
floorings and adhesives are all made to
keep the air quality high probably the
biggest impact for indoor quality of
care and lighting for our team is
actually the products that they make
method uses naturally derived non-toxic
ingredients in its products and that's a
choice that impacts factory workers as
well as the consumer as for innovation
method partnered with Gotham greens to
build a 75 thousand square foot
greenhouse on top of the factory that
greenhouse produces 1 million pounds of
food a year and they sell that to stores
and restaurants in the area methods
other Factory in Belgium it's not LEED
certified yet but they say that's in the
works while all these things can be good
for the environment and community it's
ultimately part of a bigger business
strategy the soap box houses
manufacturing bottling and distribution
all under one roof which cuts down on
its carbon footprint and costs so it
really kind of hits a trifecta for us
which is it's creating great product
that's good for people and for planet
but also really helps our business both
top and bottom line
you
